fields.description:
h3. Summary

Code block macro v. 2.2.4 is not working if the "collapsible" option is enabled.

h3. Environment
* Tested only in Confluence 5.8.18
* Code macro 2.2.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start Confluence 5.8.18 
# Manually download the [Code Macro 2.2.4|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin/versions].
# Manually upload the add-on.
# The add-on will be updated.
# If the "collapsible" option is "checked"(enabled), the macro won't work. The "expand source" link won't appear.

h3. Expected Results

The macro will expand/collapse properly.

h3. Actual Results

The "expand source" link is not appearing and you can't expand the content.
 
h3. Notes

-Only tested at the moment in Conf 5.8.18-
(i) The macro(2.2.4) is working properly on Confluence 5.10

h3.Workaround
# Downgrade manually the add-on.
or
# Delete the plugin from the plugindata table to return to the bundled version(2.1.7).
{code}
delete from plugindata where pluginkey = 'com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin'
{code}
fields.summary: Code block Macro 2.2.4 is not working(expanding) in Confluence 5.8.18

fields.description:
Hi,

we are seeing this error when trying to create a subpage with the name that already exists in our space.

The structure of what we are trying to achieve can be explained on the following example:

Lets say we have a confluence space for tutorials on programming languages. Here we would have a root subpage named Languages, a number of languages and for each of this language a *Hello World!* tutorial.

Root                 Subpages with different names               Subpages with same name

                         C++                                                         Hello World!

Languages       JavaScript                                                Hello World!

                         Python                                                     Hello World!

For this particular problem, it would be meaningful to just rename the Hello World! tutorial to also contain the respectable language name.

For our problem this does not apply and will look unprofessional.

Thank you for help, in case of any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

IL
fields.summary: Unable to create subpages with the same name in a space

My organisation has both Confluence Cloud and JIRA Cloud.

When looking into backup options, I navigated to the Backup Manager page in Confluence Administration. I noted this text "There are some limitations, so see the Site Import page for more info." and so clicked the Site Import link for more details. I then got the message attached.

 !image-2016-03-29-11-36-09-389.png|thumbnail! 

Exporting space by space isn't viable as a backup strategy. Can we please have the ability to perform a site-level import for Confluence?

fields.description:
h3. Summary
- In a space export/import the assgined tasks are missing from the profile >> Tasks with same username in both instances.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Run two Confluence instances with same username.
- Assign tasks to this user with another user.
- Export the space with the assigned tasks.

h3. Expected results
- Profile >> Tasks. All assigned tasks are imported successfully

h3. Actual results
- Profile >> Tasks. No assigned tasks.
fields.summary: Missing assigned tasks in a space XML export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41206].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Confluence allows for only one 'User Name Attribute' to be configured for each LDAP
 directory. For example, this is configured to be the *sAMAccountName* by default.  This functionality already exists in other products and allows users some flexibility as to which username they can log in with. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for at least one alternate 'User Name Attribute' (commonly *userPrincipalName* on newer versions of Windows) to be configured for each directory. 

h3. Workaround 
No workaround found.

h3. Notes
The following bug might be relevant: [CONF-37275|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-37275]. When a 'User Name Attribute' is configured and users already exist in Confluence - if you then change this field to use a different attribute and sync the directory, Confluence will create new users instead of updating the current users.
fields.summary: Allow for users to log in with more than one 'User Name Attribute' per directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41204].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When an instance uses page properties across many pages, it's really difficult to implement changes on it since we have to change them in many places. It would be helpful to have page properties in a central place (i.e. a central page) and then be able to call each Page Properties on other pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page.
# Insert a Page Properties macro.
# Save it.
# Edit the created Page Properties macro.

h3. Actual Results
# if you have 1000+ pages with Page Properties macro inserted in, you'll need to access each 1000+ page and edit it.

h3. Expected Results
To have the ability to create the all Page Properties macro in a specific page, in order to centralize it.
fields.summary: Ability to centralize Page Properties macros

h3. Summary
- Long string of text doesn't wrap and the text goes on indefinitely no matter the text size if you do not "break" it. Also happens with Tables.

h3. Environment
- Reproducible in Mac OS X Yosemite 10.10.5/ Windows 8/ Linux Ubuntu 15.04
- Reproducible in Firefox 45.0.1/ IE 10.0.92/ Chrome 49.0.2623.87 (64-bit)  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Enter a long string of text:
{noformat}
afefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafeaafefafaefafaefafafea
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
- Text will wrap according to window size. 

h3. Actual Results
- Text does not wrap if you do not break the line.
- Per the image attached, the text goes on indefinitely no matter the text size.
- Starts breaking when it is longer than the window size.

h3. Workaround
- Break the text line using:
# SPACE
# ENTER
# SHIFT+ENTER
fields.summary: Long string of text does not wrap in pages

fields.description:
When there are two user editing the Product requirement at the same time, the changes cannot be merged even if the users are editing different section on the pages.

"If the person who are editing the page concurrently have saved the page before you, when you click Save,  the following error occur "Sorry, your changes cannot be merged automatically".


h3.Step to Replicate.
# Create a new Product Requirement page
# Save it
# Get two different user to edit the page at the same time (userA,userB). Let's consider the name of these two user are userA and userB
# userA make changes at the top section of the page
# userB make changes at the botton section of the page
# userA save the changes
# userB save the changes

h3. Expected Result.
The changes of the page will be merged

h3. Observed Result
The following error appear in the userB editor "Sorry, your changes cannot be merged automatically". If the userB save the page after he see the error, userA changes will be deleted and only changes from userB remains.
fields.summary: Concurrent Editing on Product Requirement cannot be merged.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"All updates" takes time to show the latest information if using IE11 of Windows 7 x86. It usually takes a few minutes. It is because IE11 of Windows 7 x86 does not aggressively use "Cache-control: no-cache" HTTP header and because there is a bug that Confluence returns "304 Not Modified" even if there is an update when the request does not have the header.

It is not a big problem for IE11 of x64 and other browsers (i.e. Firefox), because they use "Cache-control: no-cache" HTTP request header more frequently, comparing to IE11 of x86.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install fresh Windows 7 x84
# Install IE11 on it
# Go to Confluence Dashboard via the browser

h3. Expected Results
"All updates" takes no or little time to show the latest information

h3. Actual Results
"All updates" takes time to show the latest information
 
h3. Notes
Browsers internally call {{/rest/dashboardmacros/1.0/updates}} to retrieve the updates when rendering  "All updates" page. The REST API returns "304 Not Modified" even if there is an update when the HTTP request does not include "Cache-control: no-cache" header option.

h3.Workaround
- Use Firefox or Chrome
- Or, in Internet Explorer
## Go to Cog Menu > Internet Options
## General Tab, Click Settings
## Select "Every time I visit the page" (it will always include "Cache-control: no-cache")
## Click OK
## Click OK
fields.summary: "All updates" takes time to show the latest information if using IE11 of Windows 7 x86

fields.description:
Confluence appears to mishandle editing and rendering of cifs/smb hyperlinks. I'll just refer to cifs from now on, but assume it applies to smb as well.

While the URL {{cifs://atlassian.example.org/Public}} renders correctly, the editor will not allow the link to be edited once created. Placing the cursor inside the link does not yield the edit/unlink tooltip unlike http links. The only way to change the link is to delete it and recreate.

Furthermore, Confluence appears to mishandle credentials within a cifs URL. While I understand Confluence probably strips passwords out of these hyperlinks, it is often useful to specify a guest account using cifs with an empty password.

{{cifs://GUEST:@atlassian.example.org/Public}}

This is handy because it bypasses the request for an account and password under OS X. I'm not sure what happens under other operating systems but I can imagine a similar arrangement.

The problem is that Confluence removes the colon from the credentials part, effectively unspecifying the empty password. It renders the hyperlink as:

{{cifs://GUEST@atlassian.example.org/Public}}

This results in a password prompt when activated.
fields.summary: Confluence mishandles cifs/smb URL hyperlinks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41178].
  {panel}

Confluence 5.9 filters by default all unlicensed users from mentions, the people directory, and all search selectors, as well as from search results.

In some environments, it's appropriate to still let these users be seen, so that unlicensed users are visible in:
* mentions, to help with spelling. Note that when not a user is unlicensed, these should show with a different lozenge style
* people directory, quick search and site search, to look up contact info. Note that Confluence currently does not sync phone numbers, location or other user details from external systems, so this would only really be useful today for users that have in the past had a license.

Unlicensed users should still not be selectable by default as a contributor or author. There should be a separate checkbox on the site search and cql enabled macro editor screens to allow searching for content by these users, along the same lines as the archived spaces search option.

Unlicensed users should never be available as a target of a space permission or content restriction. Users need must be licensed before they can be assigned these.
fields.summary: Add option to control whether unlicensed users are hidden

h3. Summary
In Confluence 5.5.x when going to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/157679812/Cog.png! > Add-ons, *Code Macro Plugin* offers a message to upgrade to a newer version (from 2.1.3 to 2.2.4). This new version doesn't work and generates errors in the log.

Other Add-Ons are also listed, and may also be broken.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.5.x
* Java 7
* [Code Macro Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin/versions] 2.1.3 (the system default)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/157679812/Cog.png! > Add-ons
# Confirm there's an Update button for Code Macro Plugin
# Click Update

h3. Expected Results
Plugin is updated to 2.2.4
or
No option to update

h3. Actual Results
Message appears
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{code}
2016-03-24 13:07:51,461 ERROR [UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-2] [atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader] deployPluginFromUnit Unable to deploy plugin 'com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin' from 'Unit: /home/jrichards/atlassian/data/atlassian-confluence-5.5/plugins-cache/1458785271319plugin.8528292429045245180.newcode-macro-plugin-2.2.4.jar (1458785271000)'.
 -- referer: http://jrichards.office.atlassian.com:8090/plugins/servlet/upm | url: /rest/plugins/1.0/ | userName: jrichards
2016-03-24 13:07:51,463 ERROR [UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-2] [atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader] deployPluginFromUnit Because of the following exception:
 -- referer: http://jrichards.office.atlassian.com:8090/plugins/servlet/upm | url: /rest/plugins/1.0/ | userName: jrichards
com.atlassian.plugin.PluginParseException: Unable to scan for host components in plugin classes
{code}

h3. Notes
Confluence 5.7.5 does not offer to update the *Code Macro Plugin*

h3.Workaround
# Stop Confluence
# Run this to confirm data is in the table
{code:language=sql}
select plugindataid, pluginkey, filename, lastmoddate from plugindata where pluginkey = 'com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin';
{code}
# If there's only one row where {{pluginkey}} is {{com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin}} run
{code:language=sql}
delete from plugindata where pluginkey = 'com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin';
{code}
# Delete all the files in the plugin cache (with {{rm -fr}}):
#* /var/atlassian/application-data/confluence/bundled-plugins
#* /var/atlassian/application-data/confluence/plugins-cache
#* /var/atlassian/application-data/confluence/plugins-osgi-cache
#* /var/atlassian/application-data/confluence/plugins-temp
#* /var/atlassian/application-data/confluence/bundled-plugins_language
# Restart Confluence

or

# Go to https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin/versions
# Download version for 2.1.4
# Go to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/157679812/Cog.png! > Add-ons
# Click upload
# Add {{newcode-macro-plugin-2.1.4.jar}} and upload
fields.summary: Code Macro Plugin offers update in Confluence 5.5. but is incompatible

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an administrator, I would like better logging when an UnknownHostException is thrown in Confluence. Currently the following error is thrown in the Confluence logs and a white screen with no information is displayed in the UI:

{code}ERROR [http-nio-8080-exec-4] [net.sf.ehcache.Cache] <clinit> Unable to set localhost. This prevents creation of a GUID. Cause was: HOST: HOST: unknown error
 -- referer: http://HOST:port/setup/evallicense.action | url: /setup/setupembeddeddb-default.action | userName: anonymous | action: setupembeddeddb-default
java.net.UnknownHostException: HOST: HOST: unknown error
	at java.net.InetAddress.getLocalHost(InetAddress.java:1505){code}

h3. Suggested Solution
No web application should ever throw a blank screen on error. A message at that point something like E.G. = "Cannot validate license against hostname via DNS" would be to the point. Also, that message could be explicit in the logs, rather than "an unknown error."

Bonus: you could consider doing the validation against a call to "hostname" rather than handling it as a DNS lookup as shown in [java.net.UnknownHostException exceptions in Confluence log file due to DNS lookups failing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/java-net-unknownhostexception-exceptions-in-confluence-log-file-due-to-dns-lookups-failing-394465548.html]. 

h3. Workaround 
Review the Confluence logs and edit the /etc/hosts file in order to succeed with installation.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would like better logging when an UnknownHostException is thrown in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41167].
{panel}
JIRA issues can be created directly by highlighting a text on a Confluence page. Furthermore, multiple issues can be created from highlighted text in a table.
h5. Scenario

Sometimes, while creating multiple issues through Conlufence the issues are not added into the table. On JIRA side, issues were created successfully without any error. The following error message will occurs:
{noformat}
xxx issues has been created, but there are problems in adding them to the page. You can manually add them later using JIRA macro.
{noformat}
h5. Steps to reproduce

Scenario 1: 

Consider the following steps to reproduce the issue:
 # On a {{Product Requirements}} page
 # Add new rows to "Requirements" page and enter a value on 'Title' column
 # Highlight the title of one of the rows
 # Click on 'Create Issue'
 # Click on 'Create multiple issues from table'
 # Click on 'Create'

The issue is intermittent and most of the times it works.
h5. Expected result

It is expected that the JIRA issues are successfully created on JIRA side and added correctly to the table.

Scenario 2: 

There is another scenario when same error appears but steps are different as follows:
 # On the page have some line which has @mention user in it. For example "This is test line @admin"
 # Highlight  the line "This is test line @admin".
 # Click on 'Create Issue'
 # Issue will not created in Confluence page and same message might appear. 
 # Images are attached. !Issue creation 1.png!
fields.summary: Sometimes JIRA issues are not added to Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding TIFF images with high resolution (10K - 16K) the attachment does not render a thumbnail on the page
In the case of the 16K image, the conversion processes consume all available heap memory and turning to Out Of Memory error.
In case of 2GB of heap memory the heap usage on Out of Memory event will be the following:
 !Screen Shot 2016-03-23 at 14.34.43.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Get TIFF with big pixel size (i.e. [Hubble’s Largest Images|http://hubblesource.stsci.edu/sources/illustrations/]) or scan from one of the production scanners like [Océ TC4|http://www.canon-europe.com/for_work/products/large_format_printers/technicalprint/scanning/tc4/]
# Adapt the uploading limit setting OR convert the file into grayscale to reduce the file size but keep the pixel size.
# Add it to the page
# Push Save button

h3. Expected Results
The preview generated or notification occurred that's not possible to generate a preview due to bug pixel size
h3. Actual Results
The system became irresponsive and in the log a lot of methods through an error: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
 

h3.Workaround
h5. Disable the file conversions service
You may choose to disable the file conversion service to prevent any further out of memory errors.
This means that only images (excluding tif) and PDF files will appear in the preview. Users won't be able to preview or comment on other files.

To disable the file conversion service:
 # Go to *Cog icon* > *Add-ons*.
 # Locate the *Confluence Document Conversion Library* system add-on.
 # Disable the *File Conversions* (file-conversions) module.

Once disabled, Office and other files won't appear in the preview (even if they were previously uploaded), and thumbnails for existing Office and PDF files will revert back to being placeholder thumbnails (with an icon, rather than a preview of the document). You also won't be able to view any existing inline comments on the file (as the preview is disabled).
fields.summary: High resolution TIFF images causing Out Of Memory during generation of preview

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41161].
  {panel}

The Confluence website has a login page that allows password auto-completion.
This means that users' credentials may be stored by their browser automatically, unless they have specifically configured their browser not to do so.

Note that most modern browsers will now offer to store credentials irrespective of web page password auto-completion settings. 

This issue will, however, be identified by an automated scanner, and so is included here for completion.

Recommendation:

Consider adding an attribute named "autocomplete" to the password field on the login page above that is set to "off" to explicitly demonstrate that credentials should not be stored, or, have a UI option to disable Password Auto complete.

Most modern web browsers will offer to store credentials regardless, however, this behavior may change in the future, as there is still some disagreement within the security community as to whether or not this configuration is appropriate. As such, consider performing a risk assessment to determine whether the potential risk resulting from a lack of this attribute is acceptable.
fields.summary: Provide a UI options to disable Password Autocomplete requests on the Login page

fields.description:
h3. *Environment*
- Confluence 5.9.6
- Jira 7.1.1

h3. *Steps to reproduce*
# Create an Epic Jira issue in Confluence page via Jira Issue Macro.
# Add additional text to the Confluence page.
# Save the page.
# Highlight the text to create a Jira issue (Task, Story , Bug) and ensure that the "Link to Epic" checkbox is ticked.
 !jira epic.PNG|thumbnail!

*Note that the previous bug report here (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31934) is different*

It shows a different error and the workaround doesn't work. 
Enabling Confluence Remote API also doesn't work.

The following errors are shown in the Jira logs :
{code}
2016-03-23 16:52:23,554 http-nio-8080-exec-11 ERROR admin 1012x853x1 jeozli 127.0.0.1 /rest/api/2/issue/bulk [c.a.j.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor] Returning internal server error in response
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor958.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41147].
  {panel}

When you disable the Confluence Previews plugin under the System add-ons section (Confluence administration -> manage add-ons) and search for any attachment that would be previewed, after clicking over the attachment name in the search list results, you are taken to the page that contains the attachment, however the attachment is not downloaded.

h3.Steps to replicate:

1) Create a test page
2) Insert some attachment to this page (can be an image or pdf)
3) Go to the Confluence administration -> manage add ons -> show system add ons -> Disable Confluence Preview plugin
4) Go to the dashboard and search for the attachment name
5) Click over the attachment name

h3.Expected behavior
The download window should be presented.

h3.Actual behavior
You are presented to the page itself and nothing happens. The download doesn't start.

h3.Workaround
1) In order to download the attachment you must click over the ellipsis (...) and select attachments.
2) Click over the attachment name and you will be presented the download window.

h3.Additional investigation
It seems the Attachment URL in the search list is pointing to the preview functionality. EG:
{code}
http://Confluence_Base_URL/display/~admin/attachment+preview+test?preview=%2F6881293%2F6881294%2FTEST-testpdfexportimages-291215-1436-33.pdf.
{code}
The URL should be this one ton trigger the download. EG:
{code}
http://Confluence_Base_URL/download/attachments/6881293/TEST-testpdfexportimages-291215-1436-33.pdf?api=v2
{code}
fields.summary: Confluence tries to preview attachments even when preview plugin is disabled

fields.description:
h4. Summary,
- Due to some changes in the latest versions of Confluence, it is not possible to import, in some cases, from later to earlier versions. This issue is when attachments are included.

h4. How to replicate
- Create a space and export with attachments (later major version)
- Import the space (earlier major version)

h4. Expected results
- The space is imported successfully

h4. Actual results:
- Throws the following error:
{code}Import failed. Check your server logs for more information. com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: not-null property references a null or transient value: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Attachment.contentType{code}

h4. Investigation done
- I assume it fails because of attachments table was dropped in later versions.

h4. Workaround
- Backup *without* the attachments
- From earlier to later versions works with or without attachments
fields.summary: Space backup, with attachments, fails from later to earlier versions

fields.description:
[I couldn't find a bug report mentioning this issue – I can't really imagine that nobody else is bothered by this –, but I assume I might have my search terms wrong. :) So, in case the issue was indeed already reported before, please point me there, thank you!]

In our enterprise installation of Confluence, we encounter weird issues with the Task function. Certain users prepare pages with tasks beforehand, possibly using the @user-mention syntax in order to auto-complete the user's names, but remove the @user-mention so the users won't get notified before the page is completed and the tasks become valid. Later, when everything is set up, the @user-mention is added again.

This procedure seems to provoke cascading and/or even empty user-mentions through-out the task list, which cannot be removed or tidied up by a normal user using Confluence's rich-text editor. It tends to become manyfold worse if parts of the affected tasks are being copy-pasted to new tasks. Worst of all, the problem cannot even be "seen" in edit mode, it only becomes apparent as soon as the page is saved, see screenshots 1 (page view mode) and 2 (edit mode).

Another rather disrupting side effect is that in a user's profile's task list, the tasks inadvertently enclosed in user-mention snippets will always remain displayed in a single line rather than getting line-broken, so the task list can be so long that the page has to be scrolled horizontally in order to find out on which page the task is to be found (see screenshot 3) – apart from breaking the page layout, of course (see screenshot 4).

The obvious cause of the problem appear to be SPAN tags that are being inserted into the page for certain (maybe somewhat "unorthodox"?) actions – and remain there, even if empty. In some cases, I found cascaded SPANs like the one in screenshot 5 (HTML blob of task numbered with "08" in screenshot 1). This screenshot is from page view mode, but in edit mode, the page's source looks similar. However, as the cascaded SPANs are not visible in edit mode, there is no way for the user to "correct" the syntax. Well, except for editing the HTML source code directly while in edit mode.

Anyway, I don't think this should happen in the first place. In my opinion, multiple user-mention cascades should be filtered out to a valid syntax while editing or when saving the page.

I have no idea how the users actually ended up with such a corrupted task list on one of the affected pages. However, once you end up with a corrupted task list, in can only get worse, with no way from within the rich text editor to correct or even notice the issues. So, I could only guess what the users might have done "wrong" originally, but at least I could reproduce a garanteed way to mess up a task list, just for the sake of this argument. Steps to reproduce:
 - Create a new task list from the macro
 - Type "@" and select a username, nothing more, and save the page
 - Re-enter edit-mode, and unlink the user's name. Now, from the end of the user's name, having the cursor blink right behind the last letter (move the cursor there with the cursor keys), continue typing out a task. Save the page. This should have you end up with the whole task enclosed in a @[user-mention] SPAN.
 - Once here, whenever you copy-paste even a few words from this affected task to a new task, you will end up with more and more cascades.
fields.summary: Task list messy due to multiple cascading user-mention spans (multiple @[@[user] task])

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41112].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently Resolve Comment in inline comments is associated with the Create Comment permission. As a result, users can resolve comments that they may not have the authority to do, but have Confluence permission to do.

If you remove the Space permission of Add Comment, then users cannot add or resolve comments.

The Resolved comments aren't lost. You can go to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/thumbnails/704577869/ellipsis.png! > Resolved Comments and from there you can reopen resolved comments. However, this is a manual process.

h3. Suggested Solution
Delete Comment permission is required to Resolve Comments.
Or, those with edit permissions on the page can resolve comments.
 
h3. Workaround 
Remove Create Comment permissions.
fields.summary: Resolve Comment should be associated with delete permission or edit page permission

fields.description:
I discovered a situation where a cal to [AttachmentManager.getPreviousVersions(Attachment)|https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/AttachmentManager.html#getPreviousVersions-com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Attachment-] returned all prior versions but also returned the prior version twice and also the current version.

In this example it returned versions: 43 - 67 then 67 again and 68. The current version was 68.

In this example I actually had a plugin that deleted these versions, it makes a call to {{getPreviousVersions}} and deletes (some of) them.

As a result, a call to [AttachmentManager.removeAttachmentVersionFromServer(Attachment)|https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/AttachmentManager.html#removeAttachmentVersionFromServer-com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Attachment-] actually allowed the deletion of the current version.

Even though this current version was deleted from the server, the version still appears against the page, attempts to view the attachment result in {{Attachment File Not Found}} being displayed.
fields.summary: AttachmentManager.getPreviousVersions sometimes returns current version

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Indexing takes significantly longer when running Confluence 5.9.4+ and MySQL 5.5 compared to Confluence 5.8

After addressing the previous ticket ([CONF-39746|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-39746]) regarding this issue in Confluence 5.9.1 EAP version, it looks like the issue has re-occurred in newer versions of Confluence. 

h3. Environment
* MySQL 5.5
* Confluence 5.9.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Compare amount of time taken to reindex Confluence 5.8.x and 5.9.4 running on MySQL 5.5

h3. Expected Results
# Indexing time is the same between both versions

h3. Actual Results
For many of our customers, the amount of time it takes to reindex has increased many times. In one case, the amount of time to re-index went from 1 hour on Confluence 5.8.14, to 3 days in Confluence 5.9.4.
 
h3. Notes
Many of our customers are currently running into this issue, which gets worse as their instance grows and the indexing queue gets backed up.

For some of our customers, there is no workaround as they are running Confluence on debian and cannot move to MySQL 5.6 via debian wheezy packages. Please see multiple comments added to this related bug with users still facing this issue on MySQL 5.5 for reference: [CONF-40544|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-40544] 

h3.Workaround
If customers have the option, they can update MySQL to 5.6. For some of our customers (depending on their OS), there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Indexing slowness in Confluence with MySQL 5.5

h3. Problem Definition
It is currently not possible to avoid some content from being printed or exported  (e.g. save to pdf or html)

h3. Suggested Solution
Administrators should have the possibility to configure which parts to hide when printing a page. In Server this can be achieved by using User Macros or some specific Add-ons. None of these options is available for Cloud.
fields.summary: Possibility to hide content when exporting or printing pages in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41100].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
All HTTP requests in Cloud have a 60 second timeout. When a PDF export runs longer than that, the task keeps running on the background but the .pdf generated is not returned to the customer. If another PDF export is triggered, Confluence tries to generate a new PDF, even though it already has one from the last export and again, it wont be downloadable.

There is also a 30 second retry done automatically by the smart-status timeout page from the client browser that will trigger new PDF exports. Confluence will deny a new PDF export to run with the message:
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Too many concurrent exports. 1 is max allowed.
{noformat}
but as soon as the export finishes it will start a new PDF export.

PDF exports that take longer than 1 minute are high CPU tasks. This loop of generating new pdf files can render Cloud sites unusable on certain situations.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence Cloud page with 100 external images from another Cloud site (this will fail to retrieve images for the pdf at the rate of 1 image each second.
# Export page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
pdf file is downloadable at the end of the process. If it is not, then a new PDF export downloads the previous generated file if the page wasn't modified.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence generates a pdf indefinitely until the browser is stopped.
New PDF exports are rejected but as soon as it completes, it starts a new one when it is automatically requested by the smart-status 30 second refresh.

{{confluence/home/temp}} directory contains multiple .pdf files of the same page

h3. Suggestion
Confluence could detect that there is a pdf export already in the temp directory for the same unmodified page and transfer that to the browser or provide the option for the customer to decide; in case there is dynamic content on the page and a new pdf export is explicitly requested.

h3.Workaround
- Use the Space Tools PDF Export Option: as a Space Admin, Space Tools > Content Tools > Export
fields.summary: Long running PDF exports are not downloadable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41095].
  {panel}

Confluence will send an email to a user who can 'Grant Access' whenever a user 'Request Access'' and the sequence that Confluence will use to search for the appropriate user is:
# The last person to edit the page
# All non-admin users that can set permissions on the page (given that an admin user can always set permissions)
# The page creator
# All the space administrators

Confluence will try each of these roles in turn, emailing the first user that has appropriate permissions.

Therefore, it would be more manageable to provide option for user to select only Space admin to receive an email to grant access to user to view Confluence page.
fields.summary: Allow only Space Administrator to receive an email to grant access to user to view Confluence page.

fields.description:
*h3. Steps to reproduce*
# Create a page with special characters (example : asd*@$)
# Create a task list in that page
# Create another page with the task report macro
# Note that the macro shows the task from the page in step1
# Click the link and it shows that Page is not found

*h3. Explanation*
# If Confluence page has special characters, it is saved with a pageID instead of the page name
Example : http://localhost:8090/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=18939906
# If Confluence page has no special characters, it is saved with the page name.
Example : http://localhost:8090/display/AbtABRECH/asd


*h3. Actual cause of the problem*
 The URL from the task report macro links are written wrongly.
- Actual URL from task report macro (wrong)
{code}
http://localhost:8090/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=18939906?focusedTaskId=1
{code}
- The correct link should be :
{code}
http://localhost:8090/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=18939906&focusedTaskId=1
{code}

The "?" should be replaced with a "&" in the URL.

*h3. Solution*
Upgrade to Confluence 5.9.x
fields.summary: Task report macro links wrong URL if linked page title has special characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41075].
  {panel}

h4. Summary

- When exporting space(s) the "promoted" blueprints settings are lost, and have to mannualy promote them again in the imported space.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

- Promote a blueprint (bundled) in a space.
- Export the space as XML
- Import this space

h4. Expected Results

- The promoted blueprint setting remains.

h4. Actual Results

- Missing the promoted blueprint setting.

h4. Workaround

- Promote it again mannually in the imported space.
- Below you can do it through REST API.
# We strongly advise to definitely test these on a test/staging instance before applying them to actual prod one.
# The user credential to be used *must* have admin permission on that space.
# Providing username/password as plain text as the instruction is not recommended. You can try something like this to hide the actual password from being displayed in console:
https://coderwall.com/p/dsfmwa/securely-use-basic-auth-with-curl
# template_id and blueprint_id being used must exist in the destination instance.

h3. Template

{code:java}
curl -X PUT -u <username>:<password> 'http://<hostname>:<port>/<context_path>/rest/create-dialog/1.0/promotion/promote-template/<template_id>?spaceKey=<space_key>'
{code}
e.g.
{code:java}
curl -X PUT -u admin:admin 'http://localhost:1990/confluence/rest/create-dialog/1.0/promotion/promote-template/917505?spaceKey=BT'
{code}

h3. Blueprint

{code:java}
curl -X PUT -u <username>:<password> 'http://<hostname>:<port>/<context_path>/rest/create-dialog/1.0/promotion/promote-blueprint/<blueprint_id>?spaceKey=<space_key>'
{code}
e.g.
{code:java}
curl -X PUT -u admin:admin 'http://localhost:1990/confluence/rest/create-dialog/1.0/promotion/promote-blueprint/b47ea66c-35c2-4fd5-b595-06a894449e9d?spaceKey=BT'
{code}
fields.summary: include the "promoted" blueprint settings in a space XML export
